definitions.body: brick, tile (NH id.; Aram. [[לְּבִינְתָּא]], lben-to0; Zinj. [[לבן]] (?) DHM:Sendsch.37. 59; As. libittu; Ar. libnun, labinun, libinun, libnah;un, lu/abinah;un (loan-words acc. to Frä:4f.); acc. to Thes and most from whiteness  of clay, or light colour of sun-baked bricks; so Nö:ZMG xi,1886,735 Lag:BN 139; > others regard as As. loan-word VOJ:i. 22ff.; in As. a deriv. fr. labânu, throw down, prostrate, is sought Dl:Pr 93.(cf.HWB 369));—´[[ל]] Ge 11:3 Ez Eze 4:1; cstr. [[לִבְנַת]] Ex 24:10; pl. [[לְבֵנִים]] Gn Ge 11:3 + 7 t.; sf. [[מִלִּבְנֵיכֶם]] Ex 5:19; —

brick, as building-material, Ge 11:3 (sg. coll.; elsewh. pl.) v:Ge 11:3; Ex 1:14; straw used in making Ex 5:7, cf. v:Ex 5:8, v:Ex 5:16, v:Ex 5:18, v:Ex 5:19, Is 9:9 (fig.; as inferior to [[גָּזִית]] hewn stone); incense burnt on Is 65:3 ( = roof-tiles ? cf. Che Di).
= tile, on which plan of city could be engraved ([[חקק]]) Ez Eze 4:1.
